project.teaser: The STREnGth_M consortium will contribute significantly to the planning of research and innovation in Europe by identifying future research needs in the field of road transport, by updating and supporting the coordination of strategic research agendas and roadmaps in the field...
project.objective: The STREnGth_M consortium will contribute significantly to the planning of research and innovation in Europe by identifying future research needs in the field of road transport, by updating and supporting the coordination of strategic research agendas and roadmaps in the field and by facilitating continuous exchange between road transport research related Horizon Europe partnerships and platforms. It will further analyse research, innovation and cooperation capacities in Member States, explore funding instruments on national and regional level and assess potentials of national and regional roadmaps. Within STREnGth_M the global progress of electric mobility will be tracked while measuring the feasibility of innovative solutions for prospective and emerging markets in Africa, Asia and Latin America. This will contribute to strengthen exisiting and even forge new links between European, national and regional programmes and support structures for international cooperation task forces. The partners will also identify barriers that may exist for the deployment of research results on European and on international level and they will identify education and training actions to contribute to capacity building. In order to inform and engage the vast stakeholder community, policy makers, the civil society and more, the consortium will develop elaborate dissemination strategies, support the dissemination and organisation of European and international road transport research related events. This way the dissemination of the contribution from road transport to the realization of the European Green Deal targets and the Paris Agreement can be ensured. Via the establishment of the so called Multiplier Group the engagement of the various stakeholders will be facilitated throughout the project.
project.title: Stimulating road Transport Research in Europe and around the Globe for sustainable Mobility
project.keywords: road transport research, sustainable mobility, road transport, mobility, electrification, international, global

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - STREnGth_M (Stimulating road Transport Research in Europe and around the Globe for sustainable Mobility)
result.teaser: Project abstract: The STREnGth_M consortium is contributing significantly to the planning of research and innovation in Europe by identifying future research needs in the field of road transport, by updating and supporting the coordination of strategic research agendas and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Training actions supporting road transport area in Europe and internationally
result.description: Training actions supporting the road transport area in Europe and internationally will be defined and described in this deliverable report.

result.title: Future research needs
result.description: In close collaboration between project partners, partner RWTH will compile a comprehensive overview of future research needs, thereby also defining research gaps, in the area of road transport research.

result.title: Dissemination strategies
result.description: The initial dissemination strategies will be described in this report

result.title: Breaking the silos: integrated approaches to foster sustainable development and climate action

details.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

result.title: Barriers for the deployment of research results
result.description: This public report will summarize the barriers for the deployment of research results that have been found in the analysis.

result.title: Dissemination strategies revision 1
result.description: The first revision of the dissemination strategies will be described in this deliverable.

result.title: Timing for roadmap updates
result.description: In order to generally support the ERTRAC roadmapping process and to work together more efficiently partner RICD in collaboration with ERTRAC working group leaders will set up an expected schedule for roadmap updates

result.title: Visualization of the sustainable RTR landscape at EU Member States level
result.description: ERTICO will develop a visualization of the analysed, sustainable RTR landscape at EU Member States level.

result.title: Roadmapping methods on European, Member State and international level
result.description: Current roadmapping methods will be gathered and analysed by CRF The findings will be summarized in the corresponding deliverable report

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
